value:
My disciple Gharnef has a great
talent for magic, but his heart has
been consumed by darkness.

The Divine Dragon Naga sensed the
decline of dragons. I now know she
sought a balance with humans.

You need not worry over whether
I have food or bed. Those who walk
the path I do have no need of either.

And once this battle is over? Power
can lead to corruption. If you so wish,
I can teach you a way to shed it.

Stars and sunlight, darkness, night...
Though this world is different, that
which comprises it is still familiar.

I am Gotoh. I am here to serve those
who seek knowledge. Though, I must
say this is a far cry from my true form.

I haven't felt like this since the wars
long ago... I hadn't realized there was
still room for my strength to grow!

Only those who can trust their own
wisdom and courage can resist the
darkness and follow the light.

Oh my... I seem to have stumbled.
I wonder what Xane would say...

At times, people can achieve feats
beyond even the gods. Perhaps this
is the fruit of such labors?

I am Gotoh, just an old man who grew
weary of the world. Ask me questions
you wish answered, and I will provide.

The dragons, unable to contain their
ever-growing power, had to give up
on being dragons.$k$pBut the world was full of humans,
and so the fight to lay claim to the
dragon's legacy began.$k$pPrincess Tiki alone was hidden away
to keep her from that world... But her
contact with a human saved her.$k$pI do not believe everything a person
does is as just as one may be led to
believe by listening to his words.$k$pEven still...$k$pPerhaps the Divine Dragon knew
this was the way to save both
dragons and humans from doom.$k$pYou, too, are a unique presence and
are sure to play a grand part in this
chaotic world.$k$pI see you now, like a great dragon
that conquers light and dark.$k$pThat balancing of the scales is what
I once sought, as did the Divine
Dragon herself. So...have faith.
Ignore me at your peril!
Begone!
I think not!
Farewell.
This is where I fall.
I am Gotoh. Allow me to offer what help I can.
Please! Don't creep up on me. My heart...
Men are foolish...and I had sworn to let the affairs of this world proceed without me. But now...
There are those who call me the White Sage.
Gharnef's flesh may have been destroyed, but his spirit remains, sustained by a deep-seated malice.
Marth, I entrust Tiki to your care. Please, do your utmost to ensure that she does not slip into the darknessâ€¦
Watching your struggles, I came to think that perhaps I was too hasty in my judgment.
I go.
Hrm...
Upon your word.
